awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase I:  HumanGo, the Artificial Intelligence based Health Coach Assistant
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project will result from helping individuals achieve higher levels of wellness.  The proposed system will collect data from a user’s wearables and other devices (smart watch, wifi scale, sleep tracker…) for a novel solution. The proposed project will develop an artificial intelligence (AI) coach monitoring fatigue and fitness to continuously optimize an integrated fitness, diet, and sleep plan.  

This Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project will use advanced AI and Deep Reinforcement Learning methods to develop a system that automatically builds and updates a training plan integrating workouts, diet and recovery subject to real-life conditions such as work, sickness, etc.  Through advanced data preparation leveraging deep learning techniques, the system will cleanse the data to ensure high quality input data to the digital avatar. This avatar uses Reinforcement Learning to learn by exploration the best individualized courses of action for pre-specified goals. This system will form a novel personalized, predictive, proactive solution for monitoring health in real time at scale.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
HumanGo? was established in August 2019 with a vision of leveraging digital technology to assist all individuals in adopting a healthy lifestyle by focusing on how they exercise, manage stress, and eat. Its mission is to provide guidance for all individuals to train their bodies and minds and to achieve wellness goals through adaptive coaching and motivation, enriched by the social experience of exercising together

HumanGo? innovation lies in the invention of a truly personalized artificial intelligence health and fitness coach. Our objective is to implement an AI coach to personalize health, fitness, and performance prescriptions. We aim at providing users with physical fitness and nutrition prescriptions that keep people in optimal health.

At a more detailed level, health and fitness data from the individual is collected from wearables, and the actions (various fitness activities, sleep, stress, etc.) that led to these health and fitness states are analyzed to create a fitness model for the individual. Once this mapping of actions that lead to good and bad fitness and health for the individual is created, the algorithm derives the series of actions that will lead to optimal (highest predicted) fitness and health for that individual.

The following diagram describes the main components of the HumanGo? approach:

 

Our main objective was to prove the feasibility of implementing a virtual coach able to generate and adapt a training plan as good or better than a human coach. After months of tuning the AI Planner, we prove with testing (Turing test like: can we see the difference between the machine generated plan and the human generated plan) and real users testimonials, that HumanGo? is capable of producing individualized and adaptive training plans of high quality. 

The AI Planner is really the crown of our achievement, allowing us to integrate a large set of constraints and resolve ?near? real-time, the optimization problem to generate an adaptive and individualized training plan. The current version of the algorithm is optimizing based on the following list of constraints:

  • Routine availability of the user

  • Exceptional constraint such as vacation, work, injury affecting what can be done

  • Current fitness level of the user

  • What has been done by the user in terms of workouts

  • What is planned by the user (social ride, team run?), outside of the generated plan

  • The periodization cycles defining the major phase of training

  • The list of available workouts for each cycle to plan (~150 per cycle) 

  • Sport distribution in case of cross training or multi sport race goal

  • Energy distribution to optimize heart rate zone to maximize metabolic adaptation

  • Long day and hard day management to avoid too much stress

  • Even distribution of the workouts throughout the week

  • Increase of fitness throughout the season while maintaining fatigue below threshold

  • Injection of recovery/adaptation week to transform the accumulated load into fitness

The simplification we took to use a mathematical model as a proxy of fatigue and fitness allowed us to focus on the difficult challenge of the AI Planner and build a functioning product. The flexibility of the algorithm to account, real time, for all the constraints of the athletes is bringing a huge flexibility for structure training, increasing the stickiness of the plan without the need of a human coach. Endurance sports can be life changing, a source of inspiration and a way of life. Bringing this to the masses gives everyone access to the athlete in them. 

From the perspective of training and coaching, the extreme configurability of our approach allows HumanGo? to tackle different sports, different fitness targets (other than racing), and different training strategies. For junior coaches, it could become a great tool to help them in their coaching and learning process. For advanced coaches, it could allow them to focus on the true coaching rather than producing timetables to adapt to athletes' constraints. For athletes and even more, aspiring athletes, it gives a safe path to get to a higher level of fitness, reducing the risk of injury and overtraining. For goal-oriented people, it gives the opportunity to train with friends without compromising their fitness targets. It has the potential to significantly change how athletes and aspiring athletes get on the path of a healthy lifestyle. HumanGo? is now live and available as a commercial product on web and mobile. 

The power of the AI Planner that we have harvested in the context of endurance training plans can be now applied to other aspects of a healthy lifestyle, translating the monitoring of health into an action plan compatible with users preferences and constraints. We are now getting ready to leverage the AI Planner with nutrition.

 


Last Modified: 07/24/2021
Modified by: Eric Abecassis
